gurmukhi: DUm qy Awgr hY n durI ijm iqau Cl qy qum ko liK pwXo ]mwNghu jo qumry mn mY Ab mwNgnhwry ko rUp bnwXo ]1554]
transliteration: Dhoom Te Aagad Hai Na Durijim Tio Chhal Te Toum Ko Lakh(i) Paayo|| Maanoh Jo Toumre Man Mai Ab Maanad-hdare Ko Roop Banaayo||1554||
translation: “Just as the fire cannot be concealed by smoke, in the same manner, seeing you, I have understood your act of deceit; when you people have come in the garb of a beggar, then beg from me according to you heart’s desire.1554.

gurmukhi: jb ieh ibiD so niRp khXo khI bHm jsu lyhu ]j`g Anl qy jo mukit aupijE so muih dyhu ]1555]
transliteration: Jab Eh Bidh(i) So Nrip Kahyo Kahibrahm Jas(u) Lehu|| Jagg Anal Te Jo Moukattee Oupjio So Muh(i) Dehu||1555||
translation: When the king said like this to Brahma, then Brahma said, “O king! Become praiseworthy and give me the crown that had come out of the fire of Yajna.”1555.

gurmukhi: jb cqurwnn XoN khI puin boilE jdubIr ]gaurwN qy qw qyih dXo so muih dY niRp DIr ]1556]
transliteration: Jab Chaturaanan Yon Kahipoun(i) Balio Jadoubeer|| Gadddaan Te Taa The(i) Dayo So Muh(i) Dai Nrip Dheer||1556||
translation: When Brahma had begged it, then Krishna spoke, “Give me the amulet that had been given to you by the goddess Chandi.”1556.

gurmukhi: qb niRp mn ko ieh ibiD khY ]ry jIA jIXq n chu jug rhY ]qwN qy Drm FIl nih kIjY ]jo hir mwNgq so ieh dIjY ]1557]
transliteration: Tab Nrip Man Ko Eh Bidh(i) Kahai|| Re Jeea Jeeyat Na Chahu Joug Rahai|| Taan Te Dharam Dheel Nah(i) Keejai|| Jo Har(i) Maanad So Eh Deejai||1557||
translation: Then the king thought in his mind that he had not to live for four ages, therefore he should not delay in this task of Dharma and the things that Brhma and Krishna are begging, he should give them.1557.

gurmukhi: ikau qn kI mn SMk krY iQr qo jg mY Ab qUM n rhY hY ]Xw qy Blo n kCU ieh qy jsu lY rn AMqih mo qij jY hY ]
transliteration: Kio Tan Kiman Shank Thir To Jag Mai Ab Toon Na Rahai Hai|| Yaa Te Bhalo Na Kachhodh Eh Te Jas(u) Lai Ran Antah(i) Mo Taj(i) Jai Hai||
translation: ‘O mind ! why are you in doubt about the body, you have not to remain stable in the world for ever; what more virtuous act you can perform? Therefore do this praiseworthy task in the war, because ultimately once, the body is to be abandoned;

gurmukhi: ry mn FIl rhXo gih kwhy qy Aausr bIq ghY pCuqYhY ]Sok invwr inSMk huie dY Bgvwn so iB`Ck hwiQ n AYhY ]1558]
transliteration: Re Man Dheel Rahyo Gadh Kaahe Te Aousar Beet Gadai Pachhoutaihai|| Shok Nivaar Nishank Hue Dai Bhagvaan So Bhichchhak Haath(i) Na Aihai||1558||
translation: ‘O mind ! do not delay, because you will avail nothing except repentance, when the opportunity is lost; therefore forsaking anxiety, give away the begged articles without any hesitation, because you will never again get such beggar like the Lord himself .

gurmukhi: mwNgq jo ibiD sXwm Ary mn so qij SMk inSMk huie dIjY ]jwcq hY ijh qy sgro jg so quih mwNgq FIl n kIjY ]
transliteration: Maanad Jo Bidh(i) Syaamdare Man So Taj(i) Shank Nishank Hue Deejai|| Jaachat Hai Jih Te Sagro Jag So Tuhe Maanad Dheel Na Keejai||
translation: ‘Whatever Krishna is asking for, O my mind! give it without any hesitation; he, from whom all the world begs, he is standing before you as a beggar, therefore do not delay further;

gurmukhi: Aaur ibcwr kro n kCU Ab Xw mih qo n rqI suK CIjY ]dwnn dyq n mwn kro bsu dY Asu dY jg mY jsu lIjY ]1559]
transliteration: Aur Bichaar Daro Na Kachhodh Ab Yaa Maih To Na Ratisoukh Chheejai|| Daanan Det Na Maan Daro Bas(u) Dai As(u) Dai Jag Mai Jas(u) Leejai||1559||
translation: ‘Leave all other ideas, there will remain no shortage in your comfort; on giving charity, one should not be proud and thoughtful: therefore get the profit of approbation after surrendering everything.”1559.

gurmukhi: bwmn byK kY sXwm ju cwhq sRI hir ko iqh BUpiq dIno ]jo cqurwnn ky icq mY kib rwm khY su vhY niRp kIno ]
transliteration: Baamanndbekh Kai Syaam Ju Chaahat Srihar(i) Ko Tih Bhoopat(i) Deeno|| Jo Chaturaanan Ke Chit Mai Kabi Raam Kahai Su Vahai Nrip Keeno||
translation: Whatever Krishna had begged in the garb of a Brahmin, the king have the same to him; alongwith this, whatever was in the mind of Brahma the king also did that;

gurmukhi: jo vh mwNgiq soaU dXo qb dyq smY rs mY mn BIno ]dwn kiRpwn duhUM ibiD kY iqhu lokn mY Aiq hI jsu lIno ]1560]
transliteration: Jo Vah Maanad(i) Sooo Dayo Tab Det Samai Ras Mai Man Bheeno|| Daan Krpaan Duhoon Bidh(i) Kai Tih(u) Lokan Mai At(i) Hileeno||1560||
translation: Whatever they had asked for, the king handed it over affectionately; in this way with charity and with sword, in the bravery of both kinds, the king earned great praise.1560.
